bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, July 10, 1923

div1.p: Russell sends Carter letters and a medical record concerning West African yellow fever cases and asks for his comments.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to Henry Rose Carter, July 10, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
----
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
MEMBERS
----
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
July 10, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You will find enclosed copy of a letter from
Doctor F. E. Pettman, Senior Medical Officer, Gold Coast Har-
bours, dated Seccondee, May 25, 1923, with reference to an
Italian who died in Seccondee in May and whose case was
diagnosed as yellow fever after a post mortem examination
by Doctor Palmer, and enclosing a copy of a letter enc. 1; enc. 2 from
Doctor White, Cape Coast, concerning the case of J. F.
Hanney who died at Cape Coast in April. We should be glad
to have your comments on these cases.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Doctor H. R. Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
FRR:EP E
